title: Inside CECOT – 60 Minutes [video]
summary:
This Internet Archive entry features a video titled "Inside CECOT | 60 Minutes," which is a report by Sharyn Alfonsi for CBS News's 60 Minutes. A prominent detail is the claim that the segment was "censored by Bari Weiss," and it appeared on Canada's Global TV app.

The video item, identified as "insidececot," was uploaded by Colin Haskins on December 23, 2025, with its publication date listed as December 22, 2025. It has an item size of 1.4G and is categorized under "60 Minutes" topics. The page provides options for sharing, embedding, and flagging content for issues like graphic violence or misinformation. Users can also download the video in various formats, including H.264 IA, MPEG4, and TORRENT. As of the listing, it has accumulated 128 views, 4 favorites, and 4 reviews.
chinese_title: CECOT内幕 — 60分钟
chinese_summary:
这个互联网档案馆条目收录了一个名为“深入CECOT | 60分钟”的视频，这是莎伦·阿尔丰西 (Sharyn Alfonsi) 为哥伦比亚广播公司新闻 (CBS News) 的《60分钟》节目制作的一份报道。一个显著的细节是，该片段被声称“遭到巴里·韦斯 (Bari Weiss) 审查”，并出现在加拿大环球电视 (Global TV) 应用程序上。

该视频项目，标识为“insidececot”，由科林·哈斯金斯 (Colin Haskins) 于2025年12月23日上传，其发布日期列为2025年12月22日。它的大小为1.4G，并被归类到“60分钟”主题下。该页面提供了分享、嵌入和标记内容的选项，以举报如血腥暴力或虚假信息等问题。用户还可以下载该视频，采用多种格式，包括H.264 IA、MPEG4和TORRENT。截至列表显示，它已累计128次观看、4个收藏和4条评论。

title: Fabrice Bellard Releases MicroQuickJS
summary:
Fabrice Bellard, a highly respected developer, has officially released MicroQuickJS (mquickjs). This new project appears to be hosted on a public code repository, indicated by the 'bellard/mquickjs' naming convention.

The release has quickly garnered significant attention and positive reception from the developer community. This is evidenced by its impressive engagement metrics: the project has already accumulated 69 forks and a substantial 2,600 stars. These numbers highlight strong interest in Bellard's latest work, suggesting MicroQuickJS is perceived as a valuable and impactful contribution to the open-source landscape.
chinese_title: 法布里斯·贝拉尔发布MicroQuickJS
chinese_summary:
备受尊敬的开发者法布里斯·贝拉德已正式发布MicroQuickJS (mquickjs)。这个新项目似乎托管在一个公共代码仓库上，从“bellard/mquickjs”的命名方式便可看出。

此次发布迅速获得了开发者社区的广泛关注和积极反响。这体现在其令人印象深刻的参与度指标上：该项目已累计 69 个分支和多达 2,600 个星标。这些数字凸显了人们对贝拉德最新作品的强烈兴趣，表明MicroQuickJS被视为对开源领域一项有价值且有影响力的贡献。

title: Meta is using the Linux scheduler designed for Valve's Steam Deck on its servers
summary:
Meta (Facebook) has adopted a Linux scheduler originally designed for Valve's Steam Deck, SCX-LAVD (Latency-criticality Aware Virtual Deadline scheduler), for use on its large servers. Developed by Linux consulting firm Igalia for Valve, SCX-LAVD proved highly effective for the Steam Deck, matching or exceeding the performance of EEVDF, and has been utilized by various Linux gaming initiatives.

An interesting revelation from the Linux Plumbers Conference 2025 highlighted Meta's discovery that this scheduler, despite its handheld origins, adapts remarkably well to hyperscaler server environments. Meta engineers presented their findings on "How do we make a Steam Deck scheduler work on large servers," exploring SCX-LAVD as a potential "default" fleet scheduler.

Dubbed "Meta's New Default Scheduler" (built atop sched_ext), they found it performs excellently across a wide range of CPU and memory configurations, offering efficient load balancing. This makes SCX-LAVD suitable for general-purpose server workloads where specialized schedulers are not required.
chinese_title: Meta 在其服务器上使用专为 Valve Steam Deck 设计的 Linux 调度器。
chinese_summary:
Meta（脸书）已在其大型服务器上采纳了最初为Valve的Steam Deck设计的Linux调度器SCX-LAVD（低延迟感知虚拟截止时间调度器）。由Linux咨询公司Igalia为Valve开发的SCX-LAVD，被证明对Steam Deck非常有效，匹敌甚至超越了EEVDF的性能，并已被各种Linux游戏项目所利用。

2025年Linux Plumbers大会上一个有趣的发现揭示，Meta发现这款调度器尽管起源于手持设备，却能出色地适应超大规模服务器环境。Meta工程师展示了他们关于“我们如何让Steam Deck调度器在大型服务器上工作”的研究成果，探索将SCX-LAVD作为潜在的“默认”集群调度器。

他们将SCX-LAVD称为“Meta的新默认调度器”（构建于sched_ext之上），发现它在广泛的CPU和内存配置下表现出色，提供高效的负载均衡。这使得SCX-LAVD适用于不需要专门调度器的通用服务器工作负载。

title: X-ray: a Python library for finding bad redactions in PDF documents
summary:
X-ray is a Python library developed by Free Law Project to detect "bad" redactions in PDF documents. This problem arises when sensitive text is merely obscured by a black rectangle or highlight, rather than being properly removed, allowing the underlying text to remain selectable and readable.

The library helps assess the prevalence of such ineffective redactions. Users can provide a PDF via a local file path, a URL, or as bytes in memory. X-ray offers both command-line utility (e.g., `xray path/to/file.pdf` or `uvx --from x-ray xray URL`) and a Python API (`xray.inspect()`).

The output is provided in JSON format (or a Python object), structured as a dictionary. Keys represent page numbers, mapping to a list of dictionaries. Each dictionary describes a bad redaction, including its `bbox` (bounding box coordinates) and the `text` found beneath the redaction.

Internally, x-ray utilizes the PyMuPDF library. It works by identifying black rectangles and corresponding text in the same location. It then renders the suspected redaction area as an image and inspects it to determine if it's a solid single color, which indicates a poorly applied redaction. The project is under ongoing development to identify more varied forms of bad redactions and welcomes community contributions. It is distributed under the permissive BSD license.
chinese_title: X-ray：一个用于查找 PDF 文档中无效遮盖的 Python 库
chinese_summary:
X-ray 是由 Free Law Project 开发的一个 Python 库，用于检测 PDF 文档中的“不良”密文处理。当敏感文本仅仅被黑色矩形或高亮遮盖，而非被彻底移除时，就会出现这个问题，导致底层文本仍然可选且可读。

该库有助于评估此类无效密文处理的普遍性。用户可以通过本地文件路径、URL 或内存中的字节数据提供 PDF。X-ray 既提供命令行工具（例如 `xray path/to/file.pdf` 或 `uvx --from x-ray xray URL`），也提供 Python API（`xray.inspect()`）。

输出以 JSON 格式（或 Python 对象）提供，结构为一个字典。键代表页码，映射到一个字典列表。每个字典描述一个不良密文处理，包括其 `bbox`（边界框坐标）以及密文下方发现的 `text`（文本）。

在内部，X-ray 利用 PyMuPDF 库工作。它通过识别同一位置的黑色矩形和相应文本来运行。然后，它将可疑的密文区域渲染为图像并检查其是否为纯色，这表明密文应用不当。该项目正在持续开发中，以识别更多种形式的不良密文处理，并欢迎社区贡献。它在宽松的 BSD 许可证下分发。

title: US blocks all offshore wind construction, says reason is classified
summary:
The US Department of the Interior has abruptly halted construction on all five active offshore wind projects, citing unspecified "national security risks" revealed in a classified report from the Department of Defense. This move is controversial, as projects were already well underway—some nearly complete—and had previously undergone extensive permitting without the DoD raising such concerns.

This decision reflects a continuation of the Trump administration's animosity towards offshore wind. Previous attempts to block projects, including an executive order and holds on specific developments like Empire Wind and Revolution Wind, were often overturned by courts due to a lack of substantive reasons beyond a general dislike for wind power. Revolution Wind, for example, was 80 percent complete when it resumed construction after winning a court case against an earlier Interior Department block.

The five projects now paused include major installations like Coastal Virginia Offshore Wind (2.6 GW), Empire Wind (810 MW), Revolution Wind (700 MW), Sunrise Wind (925 MW), and Vineyard Wind 1 (800 MW), which was expected to be completed this year.

The classification of the DoD report makes legal challenges significantly more difficult. However, affected states, such as Connecticut, and the project developers, who have invested heavily, are expected to oppose this "lawless and erratic" order, which appears to circumvent previous court rulings. The article suggests this classified reason might be another attempt to halt projects without substantive justification, using classification to avoid scrutiny.
chinese_title: 美国叫停所有海上风电建设，称原因是机密
chinese_summary:
美国内政部突然叫停了所有五个在建海上风电项目的施工，理由是国防部一份机密报告披露了未指明的“国家安全风险”。此举引发争议，因为这些项目早已进展顺利，有些甚至接近完工，并且此前已通过广泛审批，国防部在此前审批中也未曾提出此类担忧。

这一决定反映了特朗普政府对海上风电的持续敌意。此前阻挠项目的尝试，包括一项行政命令以及对“帝国风电”（Empire Wind）和“革命风电”（Revolution Wind）等特定项目的搁置，往往因缺乏实质性理由（除了对风力发电普遍存在的不满外）而被法院推翻。例如，“革命风电”项目在赢得了针对内政部早期阻挠的诉讼后恢复施工时，已完成了80%。

目前暂停的五个项目包括弗吉尼亚海岸海上风电（2.6吉瓦）、帝国风电（810兆瓦）、革命风电（700兆瓦）、日出风电（925兆瓦）以及原计划于今年完工的葡萄园风电1号（800兆瓦）等主要设施。

国防部报告的机密性质使得法律挑战变得异常困难。然而，受影响的州（如康涅狄格州）以及投入巨资的项目开发商，预计将反对这项“非法且反复无常”的命令，该命令似乎旨在规避此前的法院裁决。文章指出，这一机密理由可能只是又一次缺乏实质性依据地叫停项目的尝试，意在借用机密性质以规避审查。

title: We replaced H.264 streaming with JPEG screenshots (and it worked better)
summary:
HelixML, developing an AI platform requiring screen sharing of autonomous agents, struggled to achieve reliable video streaming on diverse network conditions, particularly restrictive enterprise networks and poor WiFi.

Their initial attempt with WebRTC failed due to enterprise firewalls blocking UDP and TURN server requirements. They then engineered a sophisticated, hardware-accelerated H.264 streaming pipeline over WebSockets, leveraging HTTPS/port 443 to bypass firewalls.

Despite its technical elegance, this 40Mbps H.264 pipeline failed on shaky connections. TCP buffering led to severe latency, with video falling 30+ seconds behind real-time, making it unusable. Attempts at sending only H.264 keyframes also proved problematic due to underlying protocol limitations.

Frustrated, the team stumbled upon a simple debugging endpoint that provided instant JPEG screenshots. This revelation led them to replace their complex video pipeline with polling JPEG images via HTTP requests. JPEGs proved superior: they are self-contained (no decoder state, no corruption), smaller than H.264 keyframes (100-150KB vs. 200-500KB), and more reliable on poor networks, delivering fewer, but perfect, frames.

The final architecture is a hybrid: H.264 streaming for 60fps on good connections (RTT < 150ms), dynamically switching to 2-10fps JPEG polling on bad connections. Input (keyboard/mouse) always flows over WebSockets, with a control message toggling video. A mechanism prevents constant mode oscillation. The experience underscored that simple, gracefully degrading solutions often outperform complex, high-performance ones in real-world environments.
chinese_title: 我们用JPEG截图取代了H.264视频流，效果更好。
chinese_summary:
HelixML是一家开发需要自主代理进行屏幕共享的人工智能平台的公司。他们努力在各种网络条件下，尤其是在受限的企业网络和糟糕的WiFi环境下，实现可靠的视频流传输。

他们最初尝试使用WebRTC，但因企业防火墙阻断UDP和对TURN服务器的要求而失败。随后，他们设计了一个复杂的、硬件加速的H.264流传输管道，通过WebSockets传输，并利用HTTPS/443端口绕过防火墙。

尽管技术上很精巧，这个40Mbps的H.264传输管道在不稳定的连接下仍告失败。TCP缓冲导致严重的延迟，视频落后实时30多秒，使其无法使用。只发送H.264关键帧的尝试也因底层协议限制而存在问题。

沮丧之余，团队偶然发现了一个简单的调试端点，可以提供即时JPEG截图。这一发现促使他们用通过HTTP请求轮询JPEG图像的方式，取代了复杂的视频传输管道。JPEG证明了其优越性：它们是独立的（无需解码器状态，不会损坏），比H.264关键帧更小（100-150KB 对比 200-500KB），并且在糟糕的网络上更可靠，传输的帧数虽少，但每一帧都是完美的。

最终的架构是混合式的：在良好连接（RTT < 150ms）下，使用H.264流传输实现60fps；在不良连接下，动态切换到2-10fps的JPEG轮询。输入（键盘/鼠标）始终通过WebSockets传输，通过一个控制消息来切换视频。一个机制防止了模式的频繁切换。这一经历强调，在现实环境中，简单、优雅降级的解决方案往往优于复杂、高性能的方案。

title: The Illustrated Transformer
summary:
"The Illustrated Transformer" explains the Transformer, a neural network architecture proposed in "Attention is All You Need," designed to boost training speed for models like neural machine translation, particularly benefiting from parallelization.

At a high level, the Transformer consists of an encoding component and a decoding component, each a stack of identical encoders and decoders. Encoders process input sequences, while decoders generate output sequences. Each encoder features two sub-layers: a self-attention layer and a feed-forward neural network.

Self-attention is crucial for understanding context within a sentence, allowing the model to weigh the importance of other words when encoding a specific word (e.g., resolving "it" to "animal"). It works by creating three vectors for each word embedding: Query (Q), Key (K), and Value (V). Scores are calculated by the dot product of the Query with all Keys, normalized by softmax, then multiplied by the Value vectors and summed to produce a contextualized output for that word. This process is efficiently handled using matrix multiplication.

The model refines this with "multi-headed attention," employing multiple sets of Q/K/V matrices. Each "head" learns to focus on different aspects or positions within the input, providing diverse representation subspaces. The outputs from these multiple heads are then concatenated and linearly transformed.

Finally, to account for the sequential order of words, which is lost in the parallel processing of self-attention, the Transformer adds "positional encoding" vectors to the input embeddings. These vectors follow a specific, learnable pattern that conveys the position of each word in the sequence.
chinese_title: 图解Transformer
chinese_summary:
《图解Transformer》解释了Transformer，这是一种在论文《Attention Is All You Need》中提出的神经网络架构，旨在提升神经机器翻译等模型的训练速度，尤其受益于并行化。

宏观来看，Transformer由一个编码器组件和一个解码器组件组成，每个都堆叠了多个相同的编码器和解码器。编码器处理输入序列，而解码器生成输出序列。每个编码器包含两个子层：一个自注意力层和一个前馈神经网络。

自注意力机制对于理解句子内部上下文至关重要，它使得模型在编码特定词时，能够权衡其他词的重要性（例如，将“it”解析为“animal”）。其工作原理是为每个词嵌入创建三个向量：查询 (Q)、键 (K) 和值 (V)。通过查询向量与所有键向量的点积计算得分，经softmax归一化后，再与值向量相乘并求和，以生成该词的上下文相关输出。这个过程通过矩阵乘法高效实现。

模型通过“多头注意力”机制对此进行改进，采用多组Q/K/V矩阵。每个“头”学习关注输入中不同方面或位置，提供多样化的表示子空间。这些多头的输出随后被拼接并进行线性变换。

最后，为了考虑词语的顺序（这种顺序在自注意力机制的并行处理中丢失了），Transformer将“位置编码”向量添加到输入嵌入中。这些向量遵循特定的、可学习的模式，传达序列中每个词的位置信息。
